N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 197.32 - Surplus accounts, purpose of

State Regulations

The Surplus account is the collective title for a small
group of accounts which form the connecting link between the income account and
the balance sheet. The several accounts thereof (501 to 514) are designed to
show the changes in the surplus or deficit during each fiscal year resulting
from: (a) the operations and other
transactions during the period reflected in the income accounts, (b) appropriations or other reservations of
surplus for specific purposes; (c) accounting adjustments not properly attributable to the period (see also ยง
197.6, subd. [b]); and
(d) miscellaneous losses and gains not
provided for elsewhere. Notes
